item.title: Washington Redskins agree review of controversial team name
item.description: The review follows a fresh wave of calls to scrap a team name long-criticised as racist.

item.title: Coronavirus: England’s quarantine-free list of countries published
item.description: Greece, Belgium and Spain are among the countries on the list but Portugal and the US are not.

item.title: Zheng Yanxiong: China appoints hard-line Hong Kong security chief
item.description: Zheng Yanxiong is best known for a crackdown on protesters over a land dispute in 2011.

item.title: Jamal Khashoggi murder: Turkey puts 20 Saudis on trial in absentia
item.description: Two ex-aides of Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman are among 20 on trial in absentia for the killing.

item.title: France's Macron picks Jean Castex as PM after Philippe resigns
item.description: The French president moves swiftly to replace Edouard Philippe with a mayor from the south.

item.title: Supermarkets snub coconut goods picked by monkeys
item.description: Monkeys are treated like "picking machines" to harvest 1,000 coconuts a day, an animal rights group says.

item.title: Vanessa Guillen: Woman charged over missing soldier 'killed with hammer'
item.description: Cecily Aguilar is accused of helping to dismember and bury the body of a missing Fort Hood soldier.

item.title: Turkey fireworks: Deadly factory blasts trap workers
item.description: Explosions in north-west Turkey leave two workers dead and many more wounded.

item.title: Sikh pilgrims in deadly Pakistan train crash
item.description: At least 21 die as an express train hits a van carrying the pilgrims near the city of Lahore.

item.title: UK PM plans daily White House-style press briefings
item.description: Boris Johnson says the televised format will give the public "direct engagement" with decision-makers.

item.title: Taxi driver sets himself on fire 'over bribe'
item.description: The motorcycle taxi rider's bike had been seized for carrying passengers against coronavirus restrictions.

item.title: Jeffrey Epstein ex-girlfriend Ghislaine Maxwell charged in US
item.description: She is accused of grooming underage girls for the late paedophile Jeffrey Epstein and lying about it.

item.title: Sydney seaplane crash: Pilot was 'adversely affected by gas leak'
item.description: Five members of a British family and a Canadian pilot died when the plane plunged into a river in 2017.

item.title: Coronavirus: Protest, rally or eating out - Where is riskier?
item.description: Dr Georges Benjamin breaks down the risks of going into crowds and how best to protect yourself.

item.title: Is Facebook losing the boycott battle?
item.description: An advertising boycott wants Facebook to do more about hate speech and misinformation.

item.title: Top tips for making sure what you're seeing online is legitimate
item.description: Members of the BBC's disinformation team offer tips on how to verify photos and videos.

item.title: Quiz of the week: Which city had a coronavirus 'farewell' party?
item.description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on during the past seven days?

item.title: Africa's week in pictures: 26 June - 2 July 2020
item.description: A selection of the week's best photos from across the continent.

item.title: Pop Smoke has 'left us something special' with debut album
item.description: Radio 1 Newsbeat hears from fans of the rapper as his posthumous album is released.

item.title: France to rename streets after African WW2 heroes
item.description: Mayors are urged to honour, in streets and squares, African soldiers who fought for France .

item.title: Coronavirus: Six months that changed our world
item.description: A look back at how Covid-19 has swept the globe and altered the world in the course of six months.

item.title: Child with unicorn picture takes over TV interview
item.description: Dr Clare Wenham explained local lockdowns to viewers, despite her daughter's best efforts to distract her.

item.title: Fourth of July: Why this Independence Day will be unlike any other
item.description: With the usual parades and events on hold, it's set to be a unique year for US Independence Day.

item.title: Elisabeth Kübler-Ross: The rise and fall of the five stages of grief
item.description: Elisabeth Kübler-Ross's stages of grief are now rarely taught in a medical setting but live on in management.

item.title: TikTok's Boogaloo extremism problem
item.description: Extremists have found a home on Tiktok, and the platform is working out what to do about it.

item.title: Finding the 'invisible' millions who are not on maps
item.description: How open map data is filling in the world's missing maps and helping trace the spread of disease.

item.title: Coronavirus in South Africa: Deciding who lives and dies in a Cape Town township
item.description: Without enough supplies of oxygen or staff, health workers in South Africa are making some difficult decisions.

item.title: Sky is the limit for Pakistan's metal artist
item.description: He trained in electrical engineering, but Nasim Yousufzai's life is about metal sculptures and creations.

item.title: Coronavirus: Why has Melbourne's outbreak worsened?
item.description: A surge in infections has placed Australia's relative success story at a "critical stage", experts say.

item.title: Coronavirus: A lockdown journey from couch to kettlebells
item.description: Sometimes life throws you curveballs - and at the moment they're shaped like kettlebell weights.

item.title: Red Bull lodge protest against Mercedes steering system
item.description: Red Bull lodge an official protest against a controversial and revolutionary steering system on Mercedes' 2020 Formula 1 car.

item.title: Khabib Nurmagomedov's father and coach, Abdulmanap, dies age 57
item.description: UFC champion Khabib Nurmagomedov's father and coach, Abdulmanap, dies aged 57 following complications caused by coronavirus.

item.title: Future is dynamite for women's tennis with Gauff & Osaka, says King
item.description: Billie Jean King says the future for women's tennis is "dynamite" on and off the court thanks to young stars like Coco Gauff and Naomi Osaka.

item.title: Hamilton dominates Austrian GP practice as F1 returns
item.description: Lewis Hamilton made a powerful statement of intent as the Formula 1 season finally got under way at the Austrian Grand Prix.

item.title: England all-rounder Curran tests negative for coronavirus
item.description: England all-rounder Sam Curran returns a negative test for coronavirus.

item.title: Liverpool will not hand out appearances like Christmas presents - Klopp
item.description: Liverpool will not give Premier League appearances like "Christmas presents" to young players despite having already won the title, says boss Jurgen Klopp.

item.title: Wilson Kipsang: Marathon winner handed four-year ban for anti-doping rule violations
item.description: Former London Marathon winner Wilson Kipsang is banned for four years for anti-doping rule violations.

item.title: 'The love letter to my neighbourhood that helped me flee my country'
item.description: José Gregorio Márquez was ashamed of the place he grew up, but he came to love it before leaving it forever.

item.title: 'I've been stared at in disbelief when I introduce myself'
item.description: Four young, black entrepreneurs explain how skin colour has affected their business journey.
